quotes.text: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.
quotes.author: Bruce Lee

quotes.text: Courage is not the absence of fear, but simply moving on with dignity despite that fear.
quotes.author: Pat Riley

quotes.text: By going beyond your own problems and taking care of others, you gain inner strength, self-confidence, courage, and a greater sense of calm.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.text: Fortune favors the brave.
quotes.author: Virgil

quotes.text: Moral excellence comes about as a result of habit. We become just by doing just acts, temperate by doing temperate acts, brave by doing brave acts.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: The future doesn't belong to the faint-hearted; it belongs to the brave.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.text: The more you are motivated by Love, The more Fearless & Free your action will be.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.text: Gratitude is riches. Complaint is poverty.
quotes.author: Doris Day

quotes.text: Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.
quotes.author: Henry K. Beecher

quotes.text: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.text: Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today, and creates a vision for tomorrow.
quotes.author: Melody Beattie

quotes.text: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.text: We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit.
quotes.author: Albert Schweitzer

quotes.text: Appreciation is the highest form of prayer, for it acknowledges the presence of good wherever you shine the light of your thankful thoughts.
quotes.author: Alan Cohen

quotes.text: It is not so important to know everything as to appreciate what we learn.
quotes.author: Hannah More

quotes.text: Life is too short to waste your time on people who don't respect, appreciate, and value you.
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.text: Our passion is our strength.
quotes.author: Billie Armstrong

quotes.text: Our strength grows out of our weaknesses.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.text: More often than not, anger is actually an indication of weakness rather than of strength.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.text: Let me tell you the secret that has led me to my goal: my strength lies solely in my tenacity.
quotes.author: Louis Pasteur

quotes.text: When I dare to be powerful, to use my strength in the service of my vision, then it becomes less and less important whether I am afraid.
quotes.author: Audre Lorde

quotes.text: I hope we shall crush in its birth the aristocracy of our monied corporations which dare already to challenge our government to a trial by strength, and bid defiance to the laws of our country.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.text: Self-control is strength.
quotes.author: James Allen

quotes.text: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: Nothing has more strength than dire necessity.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.text: We must overcome the notion that we must be regular. It robs you of the chance to be extraordinary and leads you to the mediocre.
quotes.author: Uta Hagen

quotes.text: True friendship ought never to conceal what it thinks.
quotes.author: Jerome

quotes.text: When we seek to discover the best in others, we somehow bring out the best in ourselves.
quotes.author: William Arthur Ward

quotes.text: False friendship, like the ivy, decays and ruins the walls it embraces; but true friendship gives new life and animation to the object it supports.
quotes.author: Richard Burton

quotes.text: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: A friend in power is a friend lost.
quotes.author: Henry Adams

quotes.text: Rock n' roll as a genre is different from pop and hip hop: it is about bands, and that for me suggests brotherhood, family, friendship and community.
quotes.author: Steven Van Zandt

quotes.text: All I required to be happy was friendship and people I could admire.
quotes.author: Christian Dior

quotes.text: Your friend is your needs answered.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.text: There is some self-interest behind every friendship. There is no friendship without self-interests. This is a bitter truth.
quotes.author: Chanakya

quotes.text: Value your friendship. Value your relationships.
quotes.author: Barbara Bush

quotes.text: A friend is someone who gives you total freedom to be yourself.
quotes.author: Jim Morrison

quotes.text: Friendship is the marriage of the soul, and this marriage is liable to divorce.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.text: Of all possessions a friend is the most precious.
quotes.author: Herodotus

quotes.text: Friendship is one mind in two bodies.
quotes.author: Mencius

quotes.text: Some people go to priests; others to poetry; I to my friends.
quotes.author: Virginia Woolf

quotes.text: A quarrel between friends, when made up, adds a new tie to friendship.
quotes.author: Francis de Sales

quotes.text: The essence of true friendship is to make allowance for another's little lapses.
quotes.author: Ovid

quotes.text: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: It is only the great hearted who can be true friends. The mean and cowardly, can never know what true friendship means.
quotes.author: Charles Kingsley

quotes.text: Friendship, like credit, is highest when it is not used.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.text: I have friends in overalls whose friendship I would not swap for the favor of the kings of the world.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.text: Sometimes being a friend means mastering the art of timing. There is a time for silence. A time to let go and allow people to hurl themselves into their own destiny. And a time to prepare to pick up the pieces when it's all over.
quotes.author: Octavia E. Butler

quotes.text: Forgiveness is that subtle thread that binds both love and friendship. Without forgiveness, you may not even have a child one day.
quotes.author: George Foreman

quotes.text: One's friends are that part of the human race with which one can be human.
quotes.author: George Santayana

quotes.text: Friendship increases in visiting friends, but in visiting them seldom.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.text: Friendship needs no words - it is solitude delivered from the anguish of loneliness.
quotes.author: Dag Hammarskjöld

quotes.text: The most I can do for my friend is simply be his friend.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: We're born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone.
quotes.author: Orson Welles

quotes.text: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.text: Friendship is almost always the union of a part of one mind with the part of another; people are friends in spots.
quotes.author: George Santayana

quotes.text: Friends... they cherish one another's hopes. They are kind to one another's dreams.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.text: A friend may well be reckoned the masterpiece of nature.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Love, friendship and respect do not unite people as much as a common hatred for something.
quotes.author: Anton Chekhov

quotes.text: If a man does not make new acquaintances as he advances through life, he will soon find himself left alone. A man, sir, should keep his friendship in a constant repair.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.text: A friendship founded on business is better than a business founded on friendship.
quotes.author: John Locke

quotes.text: Friendship is essentially a partnership.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: Marriage: A friendship recognized by the police.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.text: Friendship is like money, easier made than kept.
quotes.author: Samuel Butler

quotes.text: Friendship... is not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.
quotes.author: Muhammad Ali

quotes.text: Friendship is always a sweet responsibility, never an opportunity.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.text: The friendship that can cease has never been real.
quotes.author: Jerome

quotes.text: The differences between friends cannot but reinforce their friendship.
quotes.author: Mao Zedong

quotes.text: Every friendship is different because everyone's personality is different.
quotes.author: Nargis Fakhri

quotes.text: The world is round so that friendship may encircle it.
quotes.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

quotes.text: Friendship is a very taxing and arduous form of leisure activity.
quotes.author: Mortimer J. Adler

quotes.text: Business, you know, may bring you money, but friendship hardly ever does.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.text: The strong bond of friendship is not always a balanced equation; friendship is not always about giving and taking in equal shares. Instead, friendship is grounded in a feeling that you know exactly who will be there for you when you need something, no matter what or when.
quotes.author: Simon Sinek

quotes.text: I define friendship as a bond that transcends all barriers. When you are ready to expect anything and everything from friends, good, bad or ugly... that's what I call true friendship.
quotes.author: Harbhajan Singh

quotes.text: Let there be no purpose in friendship save the deepening of the spirit.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.text: There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship.
quotes.author: Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: However rare true love may be, it is less so than true friendship.
quotes.author: François de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.text: Share your smile with the world. It's a symbol of friendship and peace.
quotes.author: Christie Brinkley

quotes.text: Remember that a gesture of friendship, no matter how small, is always appreciated.
quotes.author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

quotes.text: Friendship, like the immortality of the soul, is too good to be believed.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: What sweetness is left in life, if you take away friendship? Robbing life of friendship is like robbing the world of the sun. A true friend is more to be esteemed than kinsfolk.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.text: True friends stab you in the front.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: It is more shameful to distrust our friends than to be deceived by them.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.text: Friendships are the family we make - not the one we inherit. I've always been someone to whom friendship, elective affinities, is as important as family.
quotes.author: Salman Rushdie

quotes.text: The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares.
quotes.author: Henri Nouwen

quotes.text: You can always tell a real friend: when you've made a fool of yourself he doesn't feel you've done a permanent job.
quotes.author: Laurence J. Peter

quotes.text: Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece, make friendship a fine art, drink deeply from good books - especially the Bible, build a shelter against a rainy day, give thanks for your blessings and pray for guidance every day.
quotes.author: John Wooden

quotes.text: There is a magnet in your heart that will attract true friends. That magnet is unselfishness, thinking of others first; when you learn to live for others, they will live for you.
quotes.author: Paramahansa Yogananda

quotes.text: It may happen sometimes that a long debate becomes the cause of a longer friendship. Commonly, those who dispute with one another at last agree.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.text: Friendship is the source of the greatest pleasures, and without friends even the most agreeable pursuits become tedious.
quotes.author: Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: A true friend freely, advises justly, assists readily, adventures boldly, takes all patiently, defends courageously, and continues a friend unchangeably.
quotes.author: William C. Menninger

quotes.text: Never explain - your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.text: Be slow to fall into friendship; but when thou art in, continue firm and constant.
quotes.author: Isocrates

quotes.text: I have learned that friendship isn't about who you've known the longest, it's about who came and never left your side.
quotes.author: Yolanda Hadid

quotes.text: Two of man's basic needs are to love and to share. Both of these needs are satisfied in greater or lesser degree by friendship.
quotes.author: Mother Angelica

quotes.text: In romance, we feel the need to zoom in and expound on our partner's foibles in intimate detail; in friendship, we tend to do the opposite, avoiding confrontation through fear, lethargy or both.
quotes.author: Mariella Frostrup

quotes.text: True friendship is like sound health; the value of it is seldom known until it is lost.
quotes.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.text: Experts on romance say for a happy marriage there has to be more than a passionate love. For a lasting union, they insist, there must be a genuine liking for each other. Which, in my book, is a good definition for friendship.
quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.text: A friend to all is a friend to none.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: Nothing but heaven itself is better than a friend who is really a friend.
quotes.author: Plautus

quotes.text: One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.text: A friend is a gift you give yourself.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.text: Be slow in choosing a friend, slower in changing.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: A friend is, as it were, a second self.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.text: A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world.
quotes.author: Leo Buscaglia

quotes.text: If you have one true friend, you have more than your share.
quotes.author: Thomas Fuller

quotes.text: My best friend is the one who brings out the best in me.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.text: I want my friend to miss me as long as I miss him.
quotes.author: Augustine of Hippo

quotes.text: A true friend is someone who is there for you when he'd rather be anywhere else.
quotes.author: Len Wein

quotes.text: A man cannot be said to succeed in this life who does not satisfy one friend.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: A youth, when at home, should be filial and, abroad, respectful to his elders. He should be earnest and truthful. He should overflow in love to all and cultivate the friendship of the good. When he has time and opportunity, after the performance of these things, he should employ them in polite studies.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: Friends are the siblings God never gave us.
quotes.author: Mencius

quotes.text: Sustaining true friendship is a lot more challenging than we give it credit for.
quotes.author: Mariella Frostrup

quotes.text: There is no friendship, no love, like that of the parent for the child.
quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.text: Acquaintances we meet, enjoy, and can easily leave behind; but friendship grows deep roots.
quotes.author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

quotes.text: The sincere friends of this world are as ship lights in the stormiest of nights.
quotes.author: Giotto

quotes.text: Fear makes strangers of people who would be friends.
quotes.author: Shirley MacLaine

quotes.text: The fact is, with every friendship you make, and every bond of trust you establish, you are shaping the image of America projected to the rest of the world. That is so important. So when you study abroad, you're actually helping to make America stronger.
quotes.author: Michelle Obama

quotes.text: I have learned that to be with those I like is enough.
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.text: In the sweetness of friendship let there be laughter and sharing of pleasures. For in the dew of little things the heart finds its morning and is refreshed.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.text: Friendship is held to be the severest test of character. It is easy, we think, to be loyal to a family and clan, whose blood is in your own veins.
quotes.author: Charles Eastman

quotes.text: A true friend is the greatest of all blessings, and that which we take the least care of all to acquire.
quotes.author: François de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.text: Friendship is one of our most treasured relationships, but it isn't codified and celebrated; it's never going to give you a party.
quotes.author: Hanya Yanagihara

quotes.text: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
quotes.author: Walter Winchell

quotes.text: Sweet is the memory of distant friends! Like the mellow rays of the departing sun, it falls tenderly, yet sadly, on the heart.
quotes.author: Washington Irving

quotes.text: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.
quotes.author: Seneca the Younger

quotes.text: Friendship is an arrangement by which we undertake to exchange small favors for big ones.
quotes.author: Montesquieu

quotes.text: I destroy my enemies when I make them my friends.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: He has no enemies, but is intensely disliked by his friends.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: We must reach out our hand in friendship and dignity both to those who would befriend us and those who would be our enemy.
quotes.author: Arthur Ashe

quotes.text: Friends are those rare people who ask how we are and then wait to hear the answer.
quotes.author: Ed Cunningham

quotes.text: Neatness begets order; but from order to taste there is the same difference as from taste to genius, or from love to friendship.
quotes.author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

quotes.text: Each friend represents a world in us, a world not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.
quotes.author: Anaïs Nin

quotes.text: Marriage is the highest state of friendship. If happy, it lessens our cares by dividing them, at the same time that it doubles our pleasures by mutual participation.
quotes.author: Samuel Richardson

quotes.text: Friendship, like love, is destroyed by long absence, though it may be increased by short intermissions.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.text: One friend in a lifetime is much; two are many; three are hardly possible. Friendship needs a certain parallelism of life, a community of thought, a rivalry of aim.
quotes.author: Brooks Adams

quotes.text: It is not so much our friends' help that helps us, as the confidence of their help.
quotes.author: Epicurus

quotes.text: You win the victory when you yield to friends.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Friendship is also about liking a person for their failings, their weakness. It's also about mutual help, not about exploitation.
quotes.author: Paul Theroux

quotes.text: I had three chairs in my house; one for solitude, two for friendship, three for society.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: Friendship is but another name for an alliance with the follies and the misfortunes of others. Our own share of miseries is sufficient: why enter then as volunteers into those of another?
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.text: It is one of the severest tests of friendship to tell your friend his faults. So to love a man that you cannot bear to see a stain upon him, and to speak painful truth through loving words, that is friendship.
quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.text: When a friend is in trouble, don't annoy him by asking if there is anything you can do. Think up something appropriate and do it.
quotes.author: A. Powell Davies

quotes.text: No distance of place or lapse of time can lessen the friendship of those who are thoroughly persuaded of each other's worth.
quotes.author: Robert Southey

quotes.text: Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: It is important to our friends to believe that we are unreservedly frank with them, and important to friendship that we are not.
quotes.author: Mignon McLaughlin

quotes.text: Loyalty and friendship, which is to me the same, created all the wealth that I've ever thought I'd have.
quotes.author: Ernie Banks

quotes.text: A passion for politics stems usually from an insatiable need, either for power, or for friendship and adulation, or a combination of both.
quotes.author: Fawn M. Brodie

quotes.text: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.text: Friendship with oneself is all important, because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else in the world.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.text: Read as you taste fruit or savor wine, or enjoy friendship, love or life.
quotes.author: George Herbert

quotes.text: Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence.
quotes.author: George Washington

quotes.text: Friendship at first sight, like love at first sight, is said to be the only truth.
quotes.author: Herman Melville

quotes.text: Remember that the most valuable antiques are dear old friends.
quotes.author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

quotes.text: Friendship brings in a lot of honesty and trust into any relationship, especially a marriage.
quotes.author: Farhan Akhtar

quotes.text: Our most intimate friend is not he to whom we show the worst, but the best of our nature.
quotes.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quotes.text: He who hath many friends hath none.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: Friendship without self-interest is one of the rare and beautiful things of life.
quotes.author: James F. Byrnes

quotes.text: I never considered a difference of opinion in politics, in religion, in philosophy, as cause for withdrawing from a friend.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.text: Two persons cannot long be friends if they cannot forgive each other's little failings.
quotes.author: Jean de La Bruyère

quotes.text: The rule of friendship means there should be mutual sympathy between them, each supplying what the other lacks and trying to benefit the other, always using friendly and sincere words.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.text: My friends are my estate.
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson

quotes.text: There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven't yet met.
quotes.author: William Butler Yeats

quotes.text: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: When the world is so complicated, the simple gift of friendship is within all of our hands.
quotes.author: Maria Shriver

quotes.text: To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.text: Creativity comes from trust. Trust your instincts. And never hope more than you work.
quotes.author: Rita Mae Brown

quotes.text: Imagination rules the world.
quotes.author: Napoleon

quotes.text: Reality leaves a lot to the imagination.
quotes.author: John Lennon

quotes.text: The world is but a canvas to the imagination.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: He who has imagination without learning has wings but no feet.
quotes.author: Joseph Joubert

quotes.text: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: Every great advance in science has issued from a new audacity of the imagination.
quotes.author: John Dewey

quotes.text: Imagination is not a talent of some men but is the health of every man.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Imagination will often carry us to worlds that never were. But without it we go nowhere.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan

quotes.text: Without leaps of imagination, or dreaming, we lose the excitement of possibilities. Dreaming, after all, is a form of planning.
quotes.author: Gloria Steinem

quotes.text: Without this playing with fantasy no creative work has ever yet come to birth. The debt we owe to the play of the imagination is incalculable.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.text: Poverty and hardship are created by false thinking.
quotes.author: Bodhidharma

quotes.text: No problem can be solved from the same level of consciousness that created it.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: We must create our own world or we will die from inaction.
quotes.author: Robert Greene

quotes.text: Anything you may hold firmly in your imagination can be yours.
quotes.author: William James

quotes.text: Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact.
quotes.author: William James

quotes.text: To hell with circumstances, I create opportunities.
quotes.author: Bruce Lee

quotes.text: If you're trying to create a company, it's like baking a cake. You have to have all the ingredients in the right proportion.
quotes.author: Elon Musk

quotes.text: My religion consists of a humble admiration of the illimitable superior spirit who reveals himself in the slight details we are able to perceive with our frail and feeble mind.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: It is very easy to forgive others their mistakes; it takes more grit to forgive them for having witnessed your own.
quotes.author: Jessamyn West

quotes.text: I do not know the American gentleman, god forgive me for putting two such words together.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.text: Judge nothing, you will be happy. Forgive everything, you will be happier. Love everything, you will be happiest.
quotes.author: Sri Chinmoy

quotes.text: All the great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: The two most powerful warriors are patience and time.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.text: Just be patient. Let the game come to you. Don't rush. Be quick, but don't hurry.
quotes.author: Earl Monroe

quotes.text: I endeavor to be wise when I cannot be merry, easy when I cannot be glad, content with what cannot be mended and patient when there is no redress.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Montagu

quotes.text: You can't stay in your corner of the Forest waiting for others to come to you. You have to go to them sometimes.
quotes.author: A.A. Milne

quotes.text: Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.text: Your mind will answer most questions if you learn to relax and wait for the answer.
quotes.author: William Burroughs

quotes.text: People ask me what I do in winter when there's no baseball. I'll tell you what I do. I stare out the window and wait for spring.
quotes.author: Rogers Hornsby

quotes.text: When I was 40, my doctor advised me that a man in his 40s shouldn't play tennis. I heeded his advice carefully and could hardly wait until I reached 50 to start again.
quotes.author: Hugo Black

quotes.text: Nothing is at last sacred but the integrity of your own mind.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: If you genuinely want something, don't wait for it - teach yourself.
quotes.author: Gurbaksh Chahal

quotes.text: Formal education will make you a living, self-education will make you a fortune.
quotes.author: Jim Rohn

quotes.text: You cannot push anyone up a ladder unless he is willing to climb a little himself.
quotes.author: Andrew Carnegie

quotes.text: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to reform.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: A day wasted on others is not wasted on one's self.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.text: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: Trust thyself: every heart vibrates to that iron string.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Hope itself is like a star- not to be seen in the sunshine of prosperity, and only to be discovered in the night of adversity.
quotes.author: Charles Spurgeon

quotes.text: But at any rate, the point is that God is what nobody admits to being, and everybody really is.
quotes.author: Alan Watts

quotes.text: Things are as they are. Looking out into it the universe at night, we make no comparisons between right and wrong stars, nor between well and badly arranged constellations.
quotes.author: Alan Watts

quotes.text: You are that vast thing that you see far, far off with great telescopes.
quotes.author: Alan Watts

quotes.text: Whatever we expect with confidence becomes our own self-fulfilling prophecy.
quotes.author: Brian Tracy

quotes.text: Only through our connectedness to others can we really know and enhance the self. And only through working on the self can we begin to enhance our connectedness to others.
quotes.author: Harriet Lerner

quotes.text: The self is not something ready-made, but something in continuous formation through choice of action.
quotes.author: John Dewey

quotes.text: With the realization of one's own potential and self-confidence in one's ability, one can build a better world.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.text: When we quit thinking primarily about ourselves and our own self-preservation, we undergo a truly heroic transformation of consciousness.
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.text: The aim of life is self-development. To realize one's nature perfectly - that is what each of us is here for.

quotes.text: The greater part of human pain is unnecessary. It is self-created as long as the unobserved mind runs your life.

quotes.text: I, too, do not envision a doctrine of self the clinging to which there would not arise sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: To free us from the expectations of others, to give us back to ourselves... there lies the great, singular power of self-respect.
quotes.author: Joan Didion

quotes.text: Good luck is another name for tenacity of purpose.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Golf is a game in which one endeavors to control a ball with implements ill adapted for the purpose.

quotes.text: When you dance, your purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It's to enjoy each step along the way.

quotes.text: There is not one big cosmic meaning for all, there is only the meaning we each give to our life.

quotes.text: Meaning is not what you start with but what you end up with.

quotes.text: How is it possible to find meaning in a finite world, given my waist and shirt size?

quotes.text: One needs something to believe in, something for which one can have whole-hearted enthusiasm. One needs to feel that one's life has meaning, that one is needed in this world.

quotes.text: The wisest men follow their own direction.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.text: Love does not consist of gazing at each other, but in looking together in the same direction.
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quotes.text: Each man has his own vocation; his talent is his call. There is one direction in which all space is open to him.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: It is not fair to ask of others what you are unwilling to do yourself.

quotes.text: Serious sport has nothing to do with fair play. It is bound up with hatred, jealousy, boastfulness, disregard of all rules and sadistic pleasure in witnessing violence. In other words, it is war minus the shooting.

quotes.text: To seek greatness is the only righteous vengeance.
quotes.author: Criss Jami

quotes.text: Everyone has the right to make his own decisions, but none has the right to force his decision on others.

quotes.text: If you're walking down the right path and you're willing to keep walking, eventually you'll make progress.

quotes.text: Champions keep playing until they get it right.

quotes.text: Freedom is the right to live as we wish.

quotes.text: The right way is not always the popular and easy way. Standing for right when it is unpopular is a true test of moral character.

quotes.text: Quality means doing it right when no one is looking.

quotes.text: Humanity is acquiring all the right technology for all the wrong reasons.

quotes.text: Technology presumes there's just one right way to do things and there never is.

quotes.text: If you think you can, you can. And if you think you can't, you're right.

quotes.text: I gave my life to become the person I am right now. Was it worth it?

quotes.text: You can always count on Americans to do the right thing - after they've tried everything else.

quotes.text: If it is not right do not do it; if it is not true do not say it.

quotes.text: This is why I loved technology: if you used it right, it could give you power and privacy.

quotes.text: Take no thought of who is right or wrong or who is better than. Be not for or against.

quotes.text: Sometimes it is better to lose and do the right thing than to win and do the wrong thing.

quotes.text: Remember always that you not only have the right to be an individual, you have an obligation to be one.

quotes.text: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the world.

quotes.text: Peace begins with a smile.

quotes.text: Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.

quotes.text: Lord, make me an instrument of thy peace. Where there is hatred, let me sow love.

quotes.text: Until you make peace with who you are, you'll never be content with what you have.

quotes.text: I took a speed-reading course and read 'War and Peace' in twenty minutes. It involves Russia.

quotes.text: Until you make peace with who you are, you will never be content with what you have.
quotes.author: Doris Mortman

quotes.text: If we have a positive mental attitude, then even when surrounded by hostility, we shall not lack inner peace.

quotes.text: Peace if possible, truth at all costs.

quotes.text: In peace, sons bury their fathers. In war, fathers bury their sons.

quotes.text: The possession of knowledge does not kill the sense of wonder and mystery. There is always more mystery.

quotes.text: The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.

quotes.text: Bodily exercise, when compulsory, does no harm to the body; but knowledge which is acquired under compulsion obtains no hold on the mind.

quotes.text: Knowledge has three degrees: opinion, science, illumination. The means or instrument of the first is sense; of the second, dialectic; of the third, intuition.

quotes.text: Learning never exhausts the mind.

quotes.text: Learning is finding out what you already know.
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.text: I'm not afraid of storms, for I'm learning how to sail my ship.

quotes.text: An organization's ability to learn, and translate that learning into action rapidly, is the ultimate competitive advantage.
quotes.author: Jack Welch

quotes.text: We come to love not by finding a perfect person, but by learning to see an imperfect person perfectly.

quotes.text: It is a characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things.

quotes.text: The problem with Google is you have 360 degrees of omnidirectional information on a linear basis, but the algorithms for irony and ambiguity are not there. And those are the algorithms of wisdom.

quotes.text: In every walk with nature, one receives far more than he seeks.

quotes.text: In the sky there are no tracks. Outside there is no recluse. There are no conditioned things that are eternal. There is no instability in the Buddhas.

quotes.text: You can't shake hands with a clenched fist.

quotes.text: Your sacred space is where you can find yourself again and again.
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.text: Patience is a form of wisdom. It demonstrates that we understand and accept the fact that sometimes things must unfold in their own time.

quotes.text: Whoever doesn't flare up at someone who's angry wins a battle hard to win.

quotes.text: As a water bead on a lotus leaf, as water on a red lily, does not adhere, so the sage does not adhere to the seen, the heard, or the sensed.

quotes.text: The teacher who is indeed wise does not bid you to enter the house of his wisdom but rather leads you to the threshold of your mind.

quotes.text: If you want a thing done well, do it yourself.

quotes.text: It has long been an axiom of mine that the little things are infinitely the most important.

quotes.text: Let my skin and sinews and bones dry up, together with all the flesh and blood of my body! I welcome it! But I will not move from this spot until I have attained the supreme and final wisdom.

quotes.text: If you would take, you must first give, this is the beginning of intelligence.

quotes.text: The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.

quotes.text: One who is too insistent on his own views, finds few to agree with him.

quotes.text: A monarchy conducted with infinite wisdom and infinite benevolence is the most perfect of all possible governments.
quotes.author: Ezra Stiles

quotes.text: Once you choose hope, anything's possible.
quotes.author: Christopher Reeve

quotes.text: Hope arouses, as nothing else can arouse, a passion for the possible.

quotes.text: All that I am, or hope to be, I owe to my angel mother.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: How wonderful that we have met with a paradox. Now we have some hope of making progress.

quotes.text: I find hope in the darkest of days, and focus in the brightest. I do not judge the universe.

quotes.text: Faith, as well intentioned as it may be, must be built on facts, not fiction--faith in fiction is a damnable false hope.

quotes.text: You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one, I hope someday you will join us, and the world will live as one.

quotes.text: Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all.

quotes.text: Sometimes our fate resembles a fruit tree in winter. Who would think that those branches would turn green again and blossom, but we hope it, we know it.

quotes.text: Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.

quotes.text: And the attitude of faith is the very opposite of clinging to belief, of holding on.

quotes.text: But the attitude of faith is to let go, and become open to truth, whatever it might turn out to be.

quotes.text: To have faith is to trust yourself to the water. When you swim you don't grab hold of the water, because if you do you will sink and drown. Instead you relax, and float.

quotes.text: Faith in oneself is the best and safest course.

quotes.text: To choose what is difficult all one's days, as if it were easy, that is faith.

quotes.text: Our lives are the only meaningful expression of what we believe and in Whom we believe. And the only real wealth, for any of us, lies in our faith.

quotes.text: Technology is nothing. What's important is that you have a faith in people, that they're basically good and smart, and if you give them tools, they'll do wonderful things with them.

quotes.text: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.

quotes.text: When you are offended at any man's fault, turn to yourself and study your own failings. Then you will forget your anger.

quotes.text: An ounce of emotion is equal to a ton of facts.

quotes.text: Pitching is the art of instilling fear.

quotes.text: Listen to what you know instead of what you fear.

quotes.text: As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence automatically liberates others.

quotes.text: Fear grows in darkness; if you think there's a bogeyman around, turn on the light.

quotes.text: The free man is he who does not fear to go to the end of his thought.

quotes.text: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.

quotes.text: Nothing diminishes anxiety faster than action.

quotes.text: Fear is your worst enemy. Risk is your best friend.

quotes.text: You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.

quotes.text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.

quotes.text: A fear of weakness only strengthens weakness.

quotes.text: What you are afraid of is never as bad as what you imagine. The fear you let build up in your mind is worse than the situation that actually exists.

quotes.text: Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.

quotes.text: I never worry about action, but only inaction.

quotes.text: Man should fear never beginning to live.

quotes.text: Have the fearless attitude of a hero and the loving heart of a child.

quotes.text: Be content with your lot; one cannot be first in everything.

quotes.text: The art of storytelling is reaching its end because the epic side of truth, wisdom, is dying out.

quotes.text: Living a life that has a greater purpose and living up to it is the ultimate degree that we should strive for.

quotes.text: Our attitude toward life determines life's attitude towards us.

quotes.text: Life is a process. We are a process. The universe is a process.

quotes.text: Some changes look negative on the surface but you will soon realize that space is being created in your life for something new to emerge.

quotes.text: One mistake does not have to rule a person's entire life.

quotes.text: Singleness of purpose is one of the chief essentials for success in life, no matter what may be one's aim.

quotes.text: Life is to be fortified by many friendships. To love, and to be loved, is the greatest happiness of existence.

quotes.text: Live life as though nobody is watching, and express yourself as though everyone is listening.

quotes.text: If you don't program yourself, life will program you.

quotes.text: Incredible change happens in your life when you decide to take control of what you do have power over instead of craving control over what you don't.

quotes.text: Life is either a daring adventure, or it is nothing.

quotes.text: Live and act within the limit of your knowledge and keep expanding it to the limit of your life.

quotes.text: This is such a short and precious life that it's really important that you don't spend it being unhappy.

quotes.text: Don't let making a living prevent you from making a life.

quotes.text: Even youngish men can acquire wisdom as time goes by.

quotes.text: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.

quotes.text: Always keep your mind as bright and clear as the vast sky, the great ocean, and the highest peak, empty of all thoughts. Always keep your body filled with light and heat. Fill yourself with the power of wisdom and enlightenment.

quotes.text: How is it possible that a being with such sensitive jewels as the eyes, such enchanted musical instruments as the ears, and such fabulous arabesque of nerves as the brain can experience itself anything less than a god.

quotes.text: You and I are all as much continuous with the physical universe as a wave is continuous with the ocean.

quotes.text: The philosophy of the school room in one generation will be the philosophy of government in the next.

quotes.text: There is no need for temples, no need for complicated philosophies. My brain and my heart are my temples; my philosophy is kindness.

quotes.text: Fine words and an insinuating appearance are seldom associated with true virtue
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.

quotes.text: All human wisdom is contained in these two words - Wait and Hope
quotes.author: Alexandre Dumas

quotes.text: Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.text: It takes half your life before you discover life is a do-it-yourself project.

quotes.text: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
quotes.author: Charles Darwin

quotes.text: Life is about accepting the challenges along the way, choosing to keep moving forward, and savoring the journey.
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.text: When I do good I feel good, when I do bad I feel bad, and that's my religion.

quotes.text: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
quotes.author: Sun Tzu

quotes.text: No enterprise is more likely to succeed than one concealed from the enemy until it is ripe for execution.
quotes.author: Niccolò Machiavelli

quotes.text: You have to believe in yourself.
quotes.author: Sun Tzu

quotes.text: Can you imagine what I would do if I could do all I can?
quotes.author: Sun Tzu

quotes.text: I am fond of pigs. Dogs look up to us. Cats look down on us. Pigs treat us as equals.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: In wartime, truth is so precious that she should always be attended by a bodyguard of lies.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: I am always ready to learn although I do not always like being taught.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: The best argument against democracy is a five-minute conversation with the average voter.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: The farther backward you can look, the farther forward you can see.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: Russia is a riddle wrapped in a mystery inside an enigma.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: The truth is incontrovertible. Malice may attack it, ignorance may deride it, but in the end, there it is.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: History is written by the victors.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.
quotes.author: Sun Tzu

quotes.text: If you know the enemy and know yourself, you need not fear the result of a hundred battles.
quotes.author: Sun Tzu

quotes.text: War is the continuation of politics by other means.
quotes.author: Carl von Clausewitz

quotes.text: In war, the moral is to the physical as three is to one.
quotes.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.text: I came, I saw, I conquered.
quotes.author: Julius Caesar

quotes.text: There is no instance of a nation benefiting from prolonged warfare.
quotes.author: Sun Tzu

quotes.text: The object of war is not to die for your country but to make the other bastard die for his.
quotes.author: George Patton

quotes.text: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: It is fatal to enter any war without the will to win it.
quotes.author: Douglas MacArthur
